SEARCH

Class PatientManager

java.lang.Object
PatientManager
public class PatientManager extends Object
This class manages the patient records, including adding, removing, displaying, and sorting patients, as well as performing a binary search for patients by severity.

  • Method Details

    • isListEmpty

      public boolean isListEmpty()
      Checks if the patient list is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the list is empty, false otherwise.

    • addPatient

      public void addPatient(Patient patient)
      Adds a new patient to the patient records list and saves the list to the file.
      Parameters:
      patient - the patient to be added.

    • removePatient

      public void removePatient(Patient patient)
      Removes a patient from the patient records list and saves the updated list to the file.
      Parameters:
      patient - the patient to be removed.

    • sortPatientsBySeverity

      public void sortPatientsBySeverity()
      Sorts the patients by their severity in descending order. (Selection Sort)

    • binarySearchBySeverity

      public List<Patient> binarySearchBySeverity(int severity)
      Searches for patients with the specified severity using binary search.
      Parameters:
      severity - the severity level to search for.
      Returns:
      a list of patients that match the specified severity.

    • countSeverePatients

      public int countSeverePatients(int threshold, int index)
      Counts the number of patients with severity above a given threshold, starting from a specific index.
      Parameters:
      threshold - the severity threshold.
      index - the starting index for the count.
      Returns:
      the number of patients with severity greater than the threshold.

    • displayPatients

      public void displayPatients()
      Displays all patients in the patient records list.

    • savePatientsToFile

      public void savePatientsToFile(String filename)
      Saves the patient records to a file.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file where patients will be saved.
